landing.bio: Bonjour! Hi! 今日は～！ My name is William, I speak French, English and basic Japanese. I am studying computer engineering and learning languages is my passion, both computer languages and human languages. Video game archival is important for me and I love to pen test things in my free time.

aboutWork: Develop new infrastructure solutions and tools to accelerate the creation of new features
Act as an itermediary between the security team and development team
Find and fix security vulnerabilities contained in the application
Communicate effective methodologies to prevent future security flaws by design
Optimize cross and in-service data management in C#
Develop a compiler from OpenAPI to C#
Design new REST API applications for large scale data transfer in a video game context
Design a log system with standarization of information
Organize log information in Python and Kibana

interests.paragraphOne: I enjoy reverse engineering, old games, learning new languages and low level/security stuff. I have made a data extractor from reverse engineering a game's data format and file format. This tool can extract music, 2D/3D textures and videos. I have also made a ransomware that encrypts files with AES and forces the user to play 東宝(touhou) to decrypt the files. The applications searches and scans the memory for specific information.
interests.paragraphTwo: 今日は、日本語を勉強している. I enjoy studying new languages, currently studying Japanese!

NorthSec 2019, 2019, Capture The Flag competition & Penetration Testing, Montreal
ConUHacks IV, 2019, Software hackathon, University of Concordia, Montreal
ConUHacks IV, 2019, Software hackathon, University of Concordia, Montreal
ConUHacks III, 2018, Software hackathon, University of Concordia, Montreal
PIRUS, 2017, Robotic competition, University of Sherbrooke, Sherbrooke
Won the audience’s award for the robotic competition Pirus, entirely coded in C
Canadian Computing Competition, Software algorithms, 2016, University of Waterloo, St Lambert
